items.name: Cristo de las Noas
items.address: Cerro de las Noas, Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: One of Torreón’s most iconic landmarks, offering a panoramic view of the city and featuring a well-known religious sanctuary visited by tourists and locals alike.

items.name: Canal de la Perla
items.description: A restored underground canal that now serves as a cultural space hosting art exhibitions and local events.

items.name: Arocena Museum
items.address: Cepeda Street 354 South, Downtown, Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: A museum featuring an outstanding collection of European, Mexican, and regional art, as well as temporary exhibitions and cultural activities.

items.name: Venustiano Carranza Forest
items.address: Juárez Ave. and Colón Blvd., Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: A green oasis in the heart of Torreón, perfect for walking, exercising, and enjoying outdoor family activities.

items.name: TSM Corona Stadium
items.address: Periférico Blvd. #200, Ejido El Águila, Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: A modern sports complex and home of the Santos Laguna soccer team, also hosting concerts and major events.

items.name: Plaza Mayor
items.address: Juárez Ave. and Colón Blvd., Downtown, Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: The city’s civic and cultural center, where festivals, fairs, and local celebrations take place; surrounded by modern buildings and public art.

items.name: Zaragoza Alameda
items.address: Juárez Ave. and Treviño Street, Downtown, Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: A historic park with gardens, gazebos, and recreation areas, serving as a traditional gathering spot for families and visitors.

items.name: Torreón Cable Car
items.address: Cable Car Station, Paseo Morelos, Torreón, Coahuila, Mexico
items.description: A tourist cable car connecting downtown Torreón with Cristo de las Noas, offering spectacular city views.
